item.title: Perception of Rules in India
item.description: Sixty years after the the independence, two phenomena are ubiquitous these days. One is the manner in which public anxiety shows itself over many problems with which our public institutes are beset - misuse of funds, lack of discipline, absenteeism, work stoppage, strikes and so on - all of which are in some way related with failure of some regulatory rules. Second, the growth of civil societies which seems to be outcome of government failure on social front, like markets which were the outcome of government failures on economic front.
